title: Blackbody - 2 objects absorbed and emitted energy

content.question: Blackbodies <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> have identical dimensions. Blackbody <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> at temperature <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> has peak wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> and emits radiation of power <math alttext="P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>. Blackbody <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> at temperature <math alttext="2 T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>T</mi></math> has peak wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math> and emits radiation of power <math alttext="P sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="lambda sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math> to <math alttext="lambda sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math> to <math alttext="P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="lambda sub Y is less than lambda sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub Y is less than P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="lambda sub Y is less than lambda sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub Y is greater than P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="lambda sub Y is greater than lambda sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub Y is less than P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="lambda sub Y is greater than lambda sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub Y is greater than P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="lambda sub Y is less than lambda sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub Y is greater than P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
